1.title: Perth Winter Fishing

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

1.plot: Steve and Greenie heading out past a winter storm in Perth to find huge shark mackerel that are still hunting after a big summer. Plus you'll meet new presenter Jarrad as he shares some big squid tips. The main story, however, shows you how to target pink snapper around Cockburn Sound in winter before they school up.

2.title: Skippy on Lures

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

2.plot: Bream tournament fishing is popular around Australia but the silver trevally or skippy provides even more excitement for bream anglers needing more power! In this Episode, Steve Correia and Paul Green use tiny Halco Twistys to fire skippy up into a lure feeding frenzy and use bream tackle to land dhufish and big King George whiting in deep water.

3.title: Jigging for Dhufish

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

3.plot: Dhufish are the West Australian boat fisher's #1 target.Steve and Greenie test different jigs to try and catch dhufish without bait. In the process, loads of other big fish turn up including a Perth winter capture you won't believe.

4.title: Swan River Bream Part 1

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

4.plot: Bream are just about the most popular fish in Australia, Steve and Jarrad fish the Swan and Canning Rivers to find out just where the 40cm bream are.

5.title: Big Swan River Tailor, Flathead and Bream

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

5.plot: Based entirely in the Swan River and we're going to show you tons of fishing options. While watching some astounding skiing from Show Ski WA, Steve and Jarrad walk the flats around the Burswood Casino with lures to show you how to catch bream, flathead, whiting and more. When the action is done, they head downstream into the middle of a huge tailor school full of big fish and test whether trolling baits or lures is better. I guarantee you'll be surprised at what happens.

6.title: Deep Water vs. Shallow Water

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

6.plot: Paul Green leads the team 30 miles offshore to show you the difference between what you catch in super deep water past 150 metres, compared to the 3 Mile Reef that's ten times closer to shore. Are bigger fish in deeper water or is it a myth? Some of the results will surprise you.

7.title: Finding a 40cm Bream Part 2

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

7.plot: In Part 2 we test just whether the big bream in the Swan and Canning Rivers are declining, the team share lots of spots and techniques to show you how to catch bigger bream, including a 40cm fish.

8.title: Fishing Perth's Inshore Waters

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

8.plot: Fishing grounds that anyone with even a small boat can get to, Steve and the team fish in a gale and then calm conditions to find out what works best around inshore waters near Perth that anyone with a small boat can get to.

9.title: 4WD Tips and Yellowfin Whiting at Buffalo Beach

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

9.plot: If you've got a 4WD and want to get the tyres dirty, we will help you out as 4x4 experts show you how to drive through forest hazards and on the beach. Steve ends up south of Mandurah at Buffalo Beach to target the elusive yellowfin whiting.

10.title: Mangrove Jacks and Burswood Flats

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

10.plot: Steve and Greenie head north to Point Samson to discover how to catch mangrove jacks right at your feet in scorching weather, plus they fish Burswood's flats for lots of different species in the rain including bream, flathead and tailor.

11.title: Abrolhos Adventure Part 1

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

11.plot: To finish Series 2, the Water team head from Perth to the Abrolhos Islands, taking in beach fishing for sharks, mackerel, snapper, marlin, kings, baldchin and lots more. Watch them tangle with big shovelnose sharks from a beach north of Perth, crash the 4x4 and without any sleep make their way to the islands on a day when the fish are going crazy.

12.title: Abrolhos Adventure Part 2

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

12.plot: To finish Series 2, the Water team head from Perth to the Abrolhos Islands, taking in beach fishing for sharks, mackerel, snapper, marlin, kings, baldchin and lots more. They tangle with big yellowtail kingfish, show you how to get a 3 way hookup on mackerel, catch baldchin on metal jigs and land a 400lb marlin.

13.title: Abrolhos Adventure Part 3

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

13.plot: To finish Series 2, the Water team head to the Abrolhos Islands, taking in beach fishing for sharks, mackerel, marlin, kings and more. Watch snapper mayhem as Steve and Greenie show you how to get pinkies fired up on soft plastic lures, we dive on the famous Batavia wreck and Steve lands a marlin.

1.title: Dampier

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

1.plot: The water is perhaps the world's most unique fishing TV series with host Steve Correia. Join him and his team for fishing, diving and on-water adventures.

2.title: Swan River Bream

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

2.plot: In this episode, Steve will teach you how to go breaming in the Swan River as he compares a homemade tournament boat to Australia's best, as well as sharing the best lures to use.

3.title: The Mackerel Islands Part 1

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

3.plot: Steve Correia sets out for the famous Mackerel Islands to try to find out which trolling lure is the best of them all. The dive team also dive in a place that's never been filmed before.

4.title: Cockburn Sounds

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

4.plot: Steve Correia fishes in Cockburn Sound in a hardcore tailor fishing test of boat and tackle.

5.title: Mackerel Islands Part 2

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

5.plot: The Mackerel Islands is 20km from the mining town of Onslow but the eco-tourism is far from what you'd expect from a mining town. Whales, dolphins, turtles, coral systems and spectacular beaches feature in this second part of our Mackerel Islands adventure. Plus we'll show you how to use soft plastic lures in the North West of Western Australia.

6.title: Mud Crabs and Egi Squid

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

6.plot: Glen Jakovich joins Steve Correia for an old school squidding session before learning how the new Egi squid technology can dramatically improve your catch. He'll also go mud crabbing with Noles in a Dune Buggy to find out how they catch crabs in Karratha, Western Australia.

7.title: Shark Bay Special Part 1

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

7.plot: Steve Correia, Patto and the team travel to Shark Bay to find some of the world's biggest fish, spectacular scenery and locals who are real characters. They'll land giant cobia, tailor, bluebone, GTs, mackerel and more before diving in some of world's most pristine corals.

8.title: Shark Bay Special Part 2

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

8.plot: The adventure continues in Shark Bay as Steve Correia meets Jamie Morgan, star of Farmer Wants A Wife, who takes the team fishing in some secret spots in shallow water.

9.title: Fishing Competition and Rottnest Night Dive

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

9.plot: Steve Correia and Noles go head to head in the world's stupidest fishing competition designed to teach you important tips for fishing the North West of Australia. Also, Patto and the Dive Team do an amazing night dive around Rottnest Island where the animal life is even more spectacular after sunset than it is during the day.

10.title: Deep Wreck Fishing & Diving in Perth

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

10.plot: Steve Correia and the team head to a wreck off Yanchep north of Perth to fish it from above and dive it from below. Perth Wreck Fishing can be very productive, with dhufish, samsonfish, baldchin groper, sharks and more swarming around the remains of this old oil rig and you'll witness never before seen footage of the eco-system in all of its glory. To cap it off, Paul Green catches a huge fish 800km south of where it should be. But what is it?

11.title: Perth Diving and Swan River Flathead

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

11.plot: The dive team show you some of Perth's best dive locations, including a cave where you can come face to face with as many as 20 sharks.

12.title: Perth to Jurien Bay Adventure Part 1

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

12.plot: This is the first part of a jam packed ending to the first season of the Water with Steve Correia where the team show you the massive variety of fishing and diving options from Perth to Jurien Bay if you have a 4WD or boat, or even if you don't. They'll catch tailor on lures from the beach, herring on drinking straws, sharks, Spanish mackerel and more while Patto skydives into Jurien to check out the diving, including a spectacular session with wild sea lions.

13.title: Perth to Jurien Bay Adventure Part 2

episode of.title: The Water with Steve Correia (TV Series 2011– )

13.plot: To finish off Series 1 of the Water, Steve Correia and the team show you the absolute best of Jurien Bay including a dive with sea lions that will amaze you. Plus you'll learn just how to make sure you catch Spanish Mackerel in Jurien Bay, Steve will show you how to get your kids onto fish every time from the beach, they try to catch sharks at night, badly, and Patto will scuba dive Jurien to show you the rich colours and limestone structures that create unforgettable swim-throughs.

imdb.plot outline: The Water is a fishing, diving and adventure series for the whole family. Featuring Steve Correia, Paul Green, Jarrad Louw, Paul Nolan, Nathan Patterson and a host of other fishing and diving experts, the team travel all over Australia showing the best this country has to offer. Even if you never go fishing, with the spectacular scenery both above and below the water, there's something for everyone. If you love fishing, the tips and advice will make you a much better angler. the Water is made and produced by Zulu Media.
